original:
Some protozoans have the ability to form multicellular colonies. In contrast, metazoans are defined as multicellular organisms characterized by distinct groups of cells that perform specialized functions. The fundamental types of metazoan tissues include epithelium and connective tissue, both of which are prevalent in nearly all invertebrate species.
